metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13075 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Tor Browser through 8.5.3 has an information exposure vulnerability. It allows remote attackers to detect the browser's language via vectors involving an IFRAME element, because text in that language is included in the title attribute of a LINK element for a non-HTML page. This is related to a behavior of Firefox before 68.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13075` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> doesn't affect firefox by itself fixed in firefox 68

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
